reviewText:
I really like this game, it's a good time management.

If you don't know the genre, it's a kind of solo RTS, where you are only building (no fighting involved).
Everything happens on the same screen, so you can focus on the best decision, such as using your ressources for the good building.

If you know the genre, it's a resources consuming game: you have to put all your resources (stone and food) to build a big road across the screen. There is no multi click (something I didn't like at first), but the game offers you gradually more and more villagers and you will be soon 100% loaded with all the tasks.

Something rare, the story is nice. It's short (a few panels every 10 levels), but it is surprisingly effective.

I got all levels on the expert rating, and I can say that the level design and the difficulty are well done. In the last levels, I had to use all the tricks I learned previously.
voteText: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I really, really like this game, I played a free demo on a different site before...but this one seems to have an issue, or maybe it's just my download... There's no cursor. You literally can't see where you are clicking unless you actually manage to highlight something.

reviewText: Fun game, not a big title and you can't compare it to other games but it does suck you in. Once u  decide to play it get's you right into the game, No loading time at all and never experienced any bugs or crashes. It is one of those games to play when you feel bored and got nothingg to do, it'll take your time  away. 5$ is perfect price, I would buy it even if it was  for 10$

reviewText: This game is more fun than you might think. I wasn't expecting much, given that I only paid 3 dollars and change for it, but it provided me with quite a few hours of fun.

reviewText:
I bought this game not thinking much of it, but I was immediately blown away by what I experienced in Roads of Rome.

First of all, the graphic completely blew me away.

But what really sold me on this game is the second half, when the story takes a sudden dark turn. I won't spoil it though; this is something you MUST experience for yourself. It's an absolute masterpiece in modern storytelling. Who knew Road Simulation could be this fun?

reviewText: I can't belive how satisifing this game was. i mean really. i dont' belive it.
